availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Russell (Marion County, Kentucky, farmer and slaveholder.)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky, native. Married to Sarah Ann Mattingly Russell. Father of Thomas Wallace Russell, Eliza Russell, and Susan Russell. Married to Margaret Ann McAtee Russell. Father of Frank Russell, Mattie Russell, Dell Russell, and James Russell. Farmer in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Marion County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Marion County in 1860. Farmer in Marion County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 394A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 583.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, District 1, p. 479A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Marion County, St. Mary's Precinct, p. 167B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994047, Marion County Births.
"John M. Russell (1825-1888)," Find A Grave, Memorial #52112784, accessed May 14, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52112784/john-m-russell.
